plotting module¶

plotting.plot_community_sizes_distro(clusters, output_dir='../output')[source]¶

Plot community sizes distribution for each clustering algorithm using matplotlib. :param clusters: dictionary where keys are method names, values are partition results. :type clusters: dict

Returns:

None

plotting.plot_from_data(data_dict, title, xlabel, ylabel, output_dir='../output/plots')[source]¶

Plot and save data from dictionary using matplotlib. :param data_dict: dictionary where keys are x-axis labels, values are y-axis values :type data_dict: dict :param title: title of the plot :type title: str :param xlabel: label of x-axis :type xlabel: str :param ylabel: label of y-axis :type ylabel: str :param output_dir: directory to save plot :type output_dir: str

Returns:

None

plotting.plot_single_community(graph, clusters, output_dir='../output')[source]¶

Plot single community for each clustering algorithm using matplotlib. Community is chosen as the one within a standard deviation of the mean size. :param graph: graph to analyze :type graph: nx.Graph :param clusters: dictionary where keys are method names, values are partition results. :type clusters: dict

Returns:

None

plotting.plot_statistics_community_sizes(review_graph, clusters, output_dir='../output/plots')[source]¶

Plot statistics of community sizes for each clustering algorithm using matplotlib. Statistics are mean, standard deviation, variance, median and mode. Modularity is also plotted. :param review_graph: graph to analyze :type review_graph: nx.Graph :param clusters: dictionary where keys are method names, values are partition results. :type clusters: dict :param output_dir: directory to save plots :type output_dir: str

Returns:

None

Cluster-based social network analysis for review graph
